resources.string: Placid, verdant, circa-1837 city park with a lagoon, boat rides, fountains, and other sights.
Storied, nearly 50-acre urban park that hosted British troops during the American Revolution.
This large greenspace has multiple gardens, playgrounds, ball fields, memorials, plus picnic areas.
Phillips Street Play Area is a newly renovated park, located in Beacon Hill Neighborhood of Boston, MA.
This large natural area with fields, wetlands, and ponds offers a zoo, golf course, and sports courts.
This urban recreational area offers a children\'s playground, spray fountains, and sport fields.
Upbeat outfit serving carefully sourced Asian-American fusion fare like scallion pancake sandwiches.
Spin-off of a halal food truck offers Middle Eastern standards like gyros served over the counter.
Modern bistro chain serving gourmet meat and veggie burgers. Some locations offer sushi and tacos.
This food is local, itâ€™s just-cut, when we can it is organic.
Cool cafe for counter-serve Vietnamese street food such as rice and noodle bowls, plus sandwiches.
Specializing in upmarket seafood, this contemporary chain also serves steaks and cocktails.
The Museum of Fine Arts in Boston, Massachusetts, is the fourth largest museum in the United States.
The Museum of Science is a Boston, Massachusetts landmark, located in Science Park, a plot of land spanning the Charles River.
Boston museum of international art founded by collector and philanthropist Isabella Stewart Gardner.
The USS Constitution Museum is located in the Charlestown Navy Yard, which is part of the Boston National Historical Park in Boston, Massachusetts, United States
The museum was founded as the Boston Museum of Modern Art in 1936 with a mission to exhibit contemporary art.
The John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum is the presidential library and museum of the 35th President of the United States.
Fenway Park is a baseball park located in Boston, at 4 Yawkey Way near Kenmore Square. It is the oldest ballpark in MLB.
Boston Harbor is a natural harbor and estuary of Massachusetts Bay, and is located adjacent to the city of Boston, Massachusetts.
The New England Aquarium is an aquarium located in Boston, Massachusetts.
The Freedom Trail is a 2.5-mile-long path through downtown Boston, Massachusetts that passes by 16 locations significant to the history of the United States.
The Paul Revere House was the colonial home of American patriot Paul Revere during the time of the American Revolution.
Shopping center with many stores and restaurants comprising 3 historic market buildings and a promenade.
